result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
motion to withdraw as counsel for defendant filed by Atty Kremer

Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn, filed by Atty. Ritter.

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on August 29, 2022 - Hearing may be rescheduled.**
Filed by Attorney Allison M. Ritter

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to contact the Criminal Traffic Division to sign the bond within 5 business days.

All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Check Case scheduled for July 18, 2022.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
